treat.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
treat.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The prisoners were well treated by their guards.
Despite her seniority, Margot was never treated with much respect.
I don’t know why he stays with her – she treats him like dirt.
She treats me like one of the family.
Penny doesn’t think her co-workers treat her as an equal.
He treated his automobiles almost as tenderly as he did his wife.
treat.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to deal with, regard, or consider something in a particular way
treat.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Any complaint about safety standards must be treated very seriously.
Please treat this information as completely confidential.
She treats everything I say as a joke.
treat.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to try to cure an illness or injury by using drugs, hospital care, operations etc
treat.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: It was difficult to treat patients because of a shortage of medicine.
Nowadays, malaria can be treated with drugs.
treat.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to buy or do something special for someone that you know they will enjoy
treat.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: I treated myself to a new dress.
We treated Mom to lunch at the Savoy.
treat.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to put a special substance on something or use a chemical process in order to protect, clean, or preserve it
treat.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer

treat.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it
treat.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Steven took his son to a cricket match as a birthday treat.
treat.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an event that gives you a lot of pleasure and is usually unexpected
treat.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: When we were kids, a trip to the beach was a real treat.
treat.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a special food that tastes good, especially one that you do not eat very often
treat.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The cafe serves an assortment of gourmet treats.
